meanings.definition: Have an effect or impact, especially a negative one.
meanings.sent1: The loud music impinges on my ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The storm's strong winds impinge on the stability of the old tree.
meanings.sent3: The constant noise of the construction work impinging on my peaceful reading time.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism seemed to impinge on her self-confidence like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The bitter cold of winter impinged on our outdoor plans, forcing us to stay indoors.

meanings.sent1: The new building construction impinges on the neighboring park's space.
meanings.sent2: The company's decision to expand may impinge on the local wildlife habitat.
meanings.sent3: His nosy questions impinged on her personal space, making her uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The invasive plant species impinged on the native flora, causing imbalance.
meanings.sent5: The bright city lights impinged on the view of the starry night sky.

meanings.definition: Make contact or collide with something.
meanings.sent1: The ball impinged on the goalpost and bounced back into play.
meanings.sent2: The car's side mirror impinged on the mailbox while backing out of the driveway.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail impinged on the vase, causing it to fall and break.
meanings.sent4: The falling branch impinged on the power lines, causing a temporary outage.
meanings.sent5: The airplane's wingtip impinged on the hangar door, causing minor damage.
